external_references.description: DCSO CyTec Blog. (2022, December 24). APT41 — The spy who failed to encrypt me. Retrieved June 13, 2024.
Fraser, N., et al. (2019, August 7). Double DragonAPT41, a dual espionage and cyber crime operation APT41. Retrieved September 23, 2019.
Rostovcev, N. (2021, June 10). Big airline heist APT41 likely behind a third-party attack on Air India. Retrieved August 26, 2021.

objects.description: [APT41](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0096) used WMI in several ways, including for execution of commands via WMIEXEC as well as for persistence via [PowerSploit](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0194).(Citation: FireEye APT41 Aug 2019)(Citation: Group IB APT 41 June 2021) [APT41](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0096) has executed files through Windows Management Instrumentation (WMI).(Citation: apt41_dcsocytec_dec2022)
